H0.text: Barometer is the piece of equipment a student should use to measure changes in wind speed several hours before a storm as part of their experiment.

H1.text: A hygrometer should be used by the student to measure changes in wind speed several hours before a storm.

H2.text: An anemometer should be used to measure changes in wind speed several hours before a storm as part of a student's experiment.

H3.text: A weather vane is the piece of equipment the student should use to measure changes in wind speed several hours before a storm.

A4.text: They measure wind speed based on the time of flight of sonic pulses between pairs of transducers.

A5.text: The great advantage of the tube anemometer lies in the fact that the exposed part can be mounted on a high pole, and requires no oiling or attention for years.
